member.name: T:Google.Apis.Authentication.Authenticator
member.summary: Base authentication class. Takes credentials and applicationname and is able to create a HttpWebRequest augmented with the right authentication

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Authentication.IAuthenticator
member.summary: Classes that implement this interface will know how a WebRequest with the approreate authentication embed in the request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.Authenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: an unauthenticated use case

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.Authenticator.CreateHttpWebRequest(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary:
Creates a HttpWebRequest object that can be used against a given service. for a RequestSetting object that is using client login, this might call to get an authentication token from the service, if it is not already set.
if this uses client login, and you need to use a proxy, set the application wide proxy first using the GlobalProxySelection

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.Authenticator.ApplyAuthenticationToRequest(System.Net.HttpWebRequest)
member.summary: Takes an existing httpwebrequest and modifies its headers according to the authentication system used.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.Authenticator.ApplyAuthenticationToUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Takes an existing httpwebrequest and modifies its uri according to the authentication system used. Only overridden in 2leggedoauth case
member.param: the original uri

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Authentication.Authenticator.Application
member.summary: returns the application name

member.summary: a constructor for OpenAuthentication login use cases

the consumerKey to use
the consumerSecret to use
the username to use
the domain to use

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.OAuth2LeggedAuthenticator.ApplyAuthenticationToRequest(System.Net.HttpWebRequest)
member.summary: Takes an existing httpwebrequest and modifies its headers according to the authentication system used.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.OAuth2LeggedAuthenticator.ApplyAuthenticationToUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Takes an existing httpwebrequest and modifies its uri according to the authentication system used. Only overridden in 2leggedoauth case Here we need to add the xoauthrequestor parameter
member.param: the original uri

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Authentication.AuthenticatorFactory
member.summary: A simple factory class for producing IAuthenticator This can be used as with a singleton pattern with GetInstance. Or can be constructed and passed around. Either way you must RegisterAuthenticator before you can GetRegisteredAuthenticator

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Authentication.AuthenticatorFactory.RegisterAuthenticator(Google.Apis.Authentication.AuthenticatorFactory.CreateAuthenticator)
member.summary: The delegate passed in will be used to construct IAuthenticators in multiple contexts. If you do not construct a new IAuthenticator on each call please ensure you are fetching old ones from the correct location.

member.summary: Represents a Method from Discovery Version 1.0

member.name: T:Google.Apis.OAuthBase
member.summary: The original OAuth code from http://eran.sandler.co.il/, hosted at http://oauth.net Modified only to change namespace. Written by Eran Sandler (http://eran.sandler.co.il)

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.ComputeHash(System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm,System.String)
member.summary: Helper function to compute a hash value
member.param: The hashing algoirhtm used. If that algorithm needs some initialization, like HMAC and its derivatives, they should be initialized prior to passing it to this function
The data to hash
member.returns: a Base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GetQueryParameters(System.String)
member.summary: Internal function to cut out all non oauth query string parameters (all parameters not begining with "oauth_")
member.param: The query string part of the Url
member.returns: A list of QueryParameter each containing the parameter name and value

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.EncodingPerRFC3986(System.String)
member.summary: All parameter names and values are escaped using the [RFC3986] percent-encoding (%xx) mechanism. Characters not in the unreserved character MUST be encoded. Characters in the unreserved character set MUST NOT be encoded. Hexadecimal characters in encodings MUST be upper case. Text names and values MUST be encoded as UTF-8 octets before percent-encoding them per [RFC3629]
member.param: The value to Url encode

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.NormalizeRequestParameters(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Google.Apis.OAuthBase.QueryParameter})
member.summary: Normalizes the request parameters according to the spec for the signature generation.
member.param: The list of parameters already sorted
member.returns: a string representing the normalized parameters

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GenerateSignatureBase(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generate the signature base that is used to produce the signature
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The consumer key
The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
The signature type. To use the default values use OAuthBase.SignatureTypes.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GenerateSignatureUsingHash(System.String,System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm)
member.summary: Generate the signature value based on the given signature base and hash algorithm
member.param: The signature based as produced by the GenerateSignatureBase method or by any other means
The hash algorithm used to perform the hashing. If the hashing algorithm requires initialization or a key it should be set prior to calling this method
member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GenerateSignature(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a signature using the HMAC-SHA1 algorithm
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The consumer key
The consumer seceret
The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GenerateSignature(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Google.Apis.OAuthBase.SignatureTypes)
member.summary: Generates a signature using the specified signatureType
member.param: The full url that needs to be signed including its non OAuth url parameters
The consumer key
The consumer seceret
The token, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The token secret, if available. If not available pass null or an empty string
The http method used. Must be a valid HTTP method verb (POST,GET,PUT, etc)
The type of signature to use
member.returns: A base64 string of the hash value

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GenerateTimeStamp
member.summary: Generate the timestamp for the signature

member.name: M:Google.Apis.OAuthBase.GenerateNonce
member.summary: Generate a nonce

member.summary: Provides a predefined set of algorithms that are supported officially by the protocol

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Discovery.DiscoveryService

Discovery is the root of all access to the APIs.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Util.ReadOnlyDictionary`2
member.summary: Provides the base class for a generic read-only dictionary.
member.typeparam: The type of keys in the dictionary.
The type of values in the dictionary.

remarks.para: An instance of the ReadOnlyDictionary generic class is always read-only. A dictionary that is read-only is simply a dictionary with a wrapper that prevents modifying the dictionary; therefore, if changes are made to the underlying dictionary, the read-only dictionary reflects those changes. See for a modifiable version of this class.

Notes to Implementers This base class is provided to make it easier for implementers to create a generic read-only custom dictionary. Implementers are encouraged to extend this base class instead of creating their own.

member.exception: Thrown when the dictionary is null.
